text: From the tribe of Dan: Elteke with its pasture lands, Gibbethon with its pasture lands, Aijalon with its pasture lands, and Gath-rimmon with its pasture lands.
Few men remained in the sanctuary because the famine was too much for them; the rest scattered, each to his own home.

They are like crows in midair. For when fire breaks out in the temple of these wooden or gilded or silvered gods, though the priests flee and are safe, they themselves are burned up in the fire like timbers.
As they were leaving the boat, people immediately recognized him.
Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him on the last day.
